main event: Multiple sightings of unconventional aircraft or aerial phenomena were reported near the U.S. Naval Operating Base in Kodiak, Alaska in 1949.
interesting points: Lieutenant and private individuals reported observing circular, fiery objects with high speeds and unusual flight patterns, such as swooshing or whistling sounds and rapid altitude changes.
The observations described the objects as being greenish-blue or reddish in color and estimated their altitude to be around 1500 to 5000 feet.
One sighting reported a strange circling high bus resembling a large greenish 'meteor' shell, adding to the diversity of the observed phenomena.
Weather reports from the U.S. Naval Operating Base on the date of sightings indicated scattered clouds at 5,000 feet, 15-mile visibility, and a temperature of 27 degrees.
A photostatic copy of a drawing indicating contours of atmospheric disturbance on April 8, 1950, was included as an enclosure in the report.
sighted object: circular, fiery objects with unusual flight patterns and varying colors
witnesses: Lieutenant, private individuals, bus driver, and U.S. Navy member
